isis.stitle: DT 466 / DT 530 Engine Diagnostic Manual for 4000 Series Trucks (2001) - ELECTRONIC CONTROL SYSTEM DIAGNOSTICS - CIRCUIT FUNCTION AND DIAGNOSTICS - Engine Coolant Level System (ECL)

svcsubproc.title: Signal Functions

figure.caption: Engine Coolant Level System Function Diagram

svcsubproc.para: The purpose of the Engine Coolant Level monitoring system is to signal the driver of a low coolant situation. Depending on the programming of the control module it is also capable of shutting off the engine to prevent damage to the engine due to low coolant level.

svcsubproc.title: Coolant Level Sensor
svcsubproc.para: A magnetic switch type sensor is used and located in the plastic surge tank. The magnetic switch will be open whenever the coolant level in the tank is full.

svcsubproc.title: Fault Detection / Management
svcsubproc.para: The ECM continuously monitors the ECL circuit for in-range faults. When an in-range fault is detected the Diagnostic Trouble Code 236 will be set. The diagnostic Trouble Code will not cause the warning lamp to be turned on. If the condition is intermittent, the code will be logged as an inactive code. The ECM can not detect opens or shorts in the ECL circuit.

figure.caption: Engine Coolant Level Sensor Circuit Diagram

note.para: After removing connector always check for damaged pins, corrosion, and loose terminals.

para.emph: All Tests Performed With Coolant Level Full, (plastic tank connector voltage checks)
Coolant Level Sensor connector (400) removed and ignition switch ON

entry.para: If <5V, open circuit 34B or defective ECM.
If > 0V, circuit 34G shorted to another circuit.
Voltage should be > 4.3V w/ tank full. Voltage should be < 3.4V w/ tank empty (use breakout box).

para.emph: Connector Resistance Checks (coolant level sensor connector (400) removed, measure across sensor)

entry.para: Low coolant, defective sensor or shorted sensor harness.
If >5Ω signal wire is open (with breakout box installed)
236 = ECM has detected an open or shorted circuit on the ECL circuit.
323 = The 5V circuit at pin 10 of the ECM has been pulled to ground indicating low coolant. Check cooling system.

svcsubproc.title: Extended Description
svcsubproc.para: The Engine Coolant Level sensor is used with the optional Engine Warning And Protection feature. The purpose of the Coolant Level system is to monitor the level of the coolant in the surge tank to protect the engine from damage due to engine operation when the coolant level is low. Since this is an optional feature, the system functions by programming three way warning or three way engine shutdown in the control module.

In either mode when the feature has been enabled and the engine is running, the ECM will cause the red ENGINE lamp to illuminate, an audible warning will sound, and cause the message OIL/WATER to be displayed on the odometer. This occurs whenever the coolant level is below the level of the sender in the surge tank. If the system is programmed for engine shut down, the ECM will cause the engine to stop running after the coolant level has been depleted below the coolant level sensor and the programmed warning time has expired. If the engine stops running in this condition, it can be restarted and run again for the warning time period, provided it is capable of restarting.

svcsubproc.title: Coolant Level Sensor
svcsubproc.para: The coolant level sensor uses a floating ball with a magnet and magnetic switch. With the coolant level full, the float will rise and the magnet will pull the level switch open. This will allow for 5V to be present at pin 10 of the ECM. If the level should go low, the switch will close and pin 10 of the ECM would go to 0V. The ECM must be programmed for a plastic tank for this coolant level switch to operate properly.

svcsubproc.title: Programming

caution.para: Be certain that the ECM is properly programmed for the use of a plastic surge tank.

svcsubproc.para: Coolant level monitoring is a customer programmable feature that may be programmed by the EST using the customer password. Coolant level feature is operational if programmed for three way warning or three way shutdown, however, if not programmed for three way shut down at the factory it will not be possible to enable the shutdown feature. Contact Tech Service or your International dealer to program this feature.

para.emph: ECM: Engine Coolant Level Switch Circuit Diagnostic Trouble Code

svcsubproc.para: Diagnostic Trouble Code 236 will be active when the ECM detects an in-range voltage error in the ECL circuit. Probable causes for this condition are a high resistance connection or intermittent short to ground in the circuit. An in-range Diagnostic Trouble Code will set when the ECM detects more than 3.4V but less than 4.3V at PIN 10 of the Black ECM connector for 2.0 seconds.

para.emph: ECM: Engine Coolant Below Warning/Critical Level

svcsubproc.para: Diagnostic Trouble Code 323 will be active when a low coolant situation is present and the EST will indicate COOLANT LOW. After the coolant has been restored to proper levels, Diagnostic Trouble Code 323 will remain as an inactive code and the ECM will log the engine hours and odometer reading at time of the occurrence.

svcsubproc.title: Troubleshooting
svcsubproc.para: Use the EST to monitor the coolant level on the data list or to retrieve Diagnostic Trouble Codes. Also prior engine events can be retrieved from the Event Log using the EST. This will display the engine hours and odometer reading at which the last two events happened.

note.para: Refer to S08285 - Electrical Circuit Diagrams - 4200/4300/4400
